title: Can the Franchise tax board garnish my IRA and Retirement if I own money and I don't have any other income coming in?
question: I getting my husband pension $1,000 per month and i can't pay the back taxes to FTB can they take the money from the IRA and Retirement fund? OR garnish it?
answers: The answer is yes to the extent that it is not exempt. However you have a number of options. Under some circumstances back taxes are dischrgeable in bankruptcy, so you might be able resolve the problem by filing a bankruptcy case. Even if the back taxes are not dischargeable in bankruptcy you may be able to settle the tax arrears with an offer in compromise (settlement). Additionally, you may also qualify to have the FTB either put you on currently not collectible status (where they will not actively collect you account by pursuing levies or garnishments, or give you a reasonable opportunity to make small payments under an installment agreement. You should consult with a local attorney in order to review your options.

Yes. FTB can garnish IRA and retirement income if not exempted.
Yes. Such income can be garnished.
Based on information provided you may be eligible for C7 BK which will eliminate debt and protect future income from garnishment. Carefully review your income, expenses, assets and liabilities with BK counsel to determine if your debts are dischargeable, assets protected and income protected.
I concur with Mr. Benda. May I suggest you contact a local bankruptcy attorney to protect your income and retirement accounts. There are many of us who offer free consultations.
The answer unfortunately yes, but they will usually honor the exemption amounts and usually take only 25% of the distribution.
